data.title: Popular and a bit different.
data.text: Fairly nice selection of well prepared and very fresh sushi and sashimi.  Far more authentic than most "run of the mill" type sushi restaurants with wide variety of condiment sauces and other sides and ingredients not often seen in this hemisphere.  Decor is average, help is cordial and prices a bit higher than usual likely because of the quality.

data.title: Excellent sushi!
data.text: We visited our son and daughter-in-law and this is their favorite sushi place.  The food was fresh and very good quality.  We enjoyed very good sushi.

data.title: Best sushi I've had in a long time
data.text: My title says enough. On top of that, the service was very good and friendly. I am not an expert on food of any kind, especially sushi, but it was delicious. I've tried sushi in quite a few places and the only place where I found it was as tasty as here, was in Japan. It wasn't quite as affordable though.

data.title: Great friendly sushi chefs, Good location, fresh fish
data.text: This is a lovely place to have sushi.  I can't figure out why there isn't a line out the door.  This is one of the 2 great sushi places in Pasadena.  I love to go here!  They only serve Monk Fish Liver when it is good and it is the most buttery and flavorful I have ever had.  Yellow Tail and Albacore is always outstanding.  And if you like spicy rolls, try the Mexican Roll, delicious!

data.title: Best Sushi in Pasadena
data.text: We have been going here for years since they first opened. The fish is always fresh and the selection is great. Most weeks we eat here at least once. Plus the prices are very good for the high quality of fish served!

data.title: Great undiscovered sushi place in pasadena
data.text: I love this place!  The fish is always fresh and delicious and the service is amazing.  My favorite people there are BJ and Lin.  I love how the monk fish liver sashimi is always on the plate with a little orchid.  My favorite roll is "the Mexican".  Spicy and delicious.  The shrimp tempura is light and delicious.  This place deserves a chance, go see them and tell BJ that Penny sent you.

data.title: Great sushi and amazing chefs
data.text: I love this pace. Their sushi chefs are very kind, and if you sit at the sushi bar ask how your day is and check on your food directly. Their sushi and rolls are amazing. Pick from their specials; they really fresh. The best sushi in Pasadena.

data.title: Good
data.text: Like anything on Colorado Blvd, the food was decent but pricey. The staff was friendly and the food was good. Nothing amazing but not bad. the food was fresh and we were served quickly, but for $35 I felt a little ripped off.

data.title: Consistent sushi, but nothing exciting
data.text:
Mmmmmm 
California rolls (hey, it counts as sushi! Just ask the menu!)

I can't say there is anything outstanding I experienced at this place. Nor was there anything horrible. It was fairly empty, otherwise uneventful, and if anything just another non-memory I'll be paying off on the next statement. I hear it's happening at night, but I went for a later lunch. Given its location it must be busy in order to survive. I think I will have to plan my next trip better- we arrived after the lunch menu ended but before the dinner menu started. They looked good, for some reason we were in this awkward overlap where they stay open but only offer select few things on the menu. Odd.
